title: Atlassian acquires Australian start-up Code Barrel
text:
NASDAQ-listed tech company Atlassian has acquired Australian start-up Code Barrel, who are the makers of an app called Automation for Jira which has a global customer base including Visa, Airbnb and TripAdvisor.

Sydney-based Code Barrel was founded by Nick Menere and Andreas Knecht two of the first engineers to build Atlassian's core software platform Jira.

The engineers left the company three years ago to enter start-up land and will now return to the Atlassian fold. All ten of Code Barrel's employees will move in-house to Atlassian's Sydney office.

"This marks an amazing milestone in the Code Barrel journey and is a strong testament to how far we've come from the early days (and nights) of sitting in a cafe in Vietnam working away on code," Mr Knecht wrote on his blog today.

"In many ways it feels like we never left. My co-founder Nick and I spent a collective 20 years at Atlassian and it became a massive part of our lives.

"Naturally, when we left to set up our own company, building apps for the Atlassian Marketplace, we lived by the same values."
description: Two engineers Nick Menere and Andreas left Atlassian three years ago to hit up start-up land on their own. Today, they return to the Atlassian fold.
